page.title: 07The Telephone Exchange
page.content: The Telephone Exchange is in Hawesside Street and was built in 1974. Our group was taken round by a man who answered lots of our questions. In the exchange there are 15 operators who are responsible for 16 000 telephone lines. The Southport Exchange can handle 3840 calls at any one time. We were taken into a room where we saw all the clippers going at once. We were warned that you can get an electric shock from a telephone. We went into the room where we saw ladies who were handling telephone calls. The people who work there start at 8.00a.m. and finish at 4.45p.m. In the building they have a budgie called Buzby. Buzby is the mascot that advertises British Telecom.
